Keywords: Brotherhood of Mutants , Robot
Real Name: Danger Room
Special Powers
MOVEMENT: Destroy Blocking
DANGER ROOM CONSTRUCT: When Juggernaut makes an attack, after resolutions give him an Error token for each 1 in the attack roll (maximum 3). // If Juggernaut has 2 or less Error tokens, characters take a maximum of 1 damage from Juggernaut's attacks, Juggernaut takes a maximum of 1 damage from opponent's attacks, and he can't be healed or chosen for Mastermind. Protected: Pulse Wave.
LESSONS FROM THE DANGER ROOM: JUGGERNAUT: If Juggernaut is KO'd by an opposing character, for the rest of the game, that character can use Invulnerability.
JUGGERNAUT HEADCRUSH: Leap/Climb. // When Juggernaut is given a MOVE action, after resolutions he may make a close attack.

September 5, 2022
Coyote's Own
Rules question, rules forum, terrible text formatting in actual comments, etc: The trait checks if they're receiving or taking more the 1 damage then replace that damage with 1 if it's greater than 1. No effect aside of a amped-up Pulse Way will get passed that (by which I mean if they're the target of PW that deals more than 1 damage).
September 5, 2022
Yarisdriver
Would he still do 2 damage if he used quake or would the trait supersede the power?

August 16, 2022
Geof-Force
[QUOTE=Oathful;12203445]Not quite sure why Juggernaut gets Empower, but I definitely won't complain. This guy has all the bells and whistles of a Juggernaut at a budget cost, and does his job very well. Out of all the KO effects of the second wave of Danger Room clix, his feels the most forgiving with the high amount of penetrating damage in todays game. There isn't a whole lot to say about this guy, just a highly effect piece for his cost and my favorite of the new Danger Room clix. (they also reused my favorite sculpt for Juggernaut, so bonus points in my book). Thematic: 9/10, Viability: 9.5/10, Fun Factor: 10/10, fairly balanced figure[/QUOTE] Because it's not Juggs. It's Danger using a Jugg construct. So he/it boosts the other Danger Room robots.
July 7, 2022
Oathful
Not quite sure why Juggernaut gets Empower, but I definitely won't complain. This guy has all the bells and whistles of a Juggernaut at a budget cost, and does his job very well. Out of all the KO effects of the second wave of Danger Room clix, his feels the most forgiving with the high amount of penetrating damage in todays game. There isn't a whole lot to say about this guy, just a highly effect piece for his cost and my favorite of the new Danger Room clix. (they also reused my favorite sculpt for Juggernaut, so bonus points in my book). Thematic: 9/10, Viability: 9.5/10, Fun Factor: 10/10, fairly balanced figure
